titles.title: To amend the Energy Policy and Conservation Act to provide for the dissemination of information regarding available Federal programs relating to energy efficiency projects for schools, and for other purposes.
Streamlining Energy Efficiency for Schools Act of 2019
Streamlining Energy Efficiency for Schools Act of 2019
Streamlining Energy Efficiency for Schools Act

Streamlining Energy Efficiency for Schools Act of 2019
Streamlining Energy Efficiency for Schools Act of 2019

Streamlining Energy Efficiency for Schools Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy.
Mr. Tonko moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 762.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Murkowski with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 116-108.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 208.

bill.summary:
Streamlining Energy Efficiency for Schools Act of 2019
This bill directs the Department of Energy's Office of Energy and Renewable Energy to establish a clearinghouse for disseminating information regarding available programs and financing mechanisms that may be used to help initiate, develop, and finance energy efficiency, distributed generation, and energy retrofitting projects for schools.
